page.title: 12Hannington - A Biography (1)
page.content: Dame Betty Ridley born September 1909, in Poplar (father Rector to 1919 then Bishop of Stepney for 9 years) atten- ded Cheltenham Ladies College from where she wrote her father of her com- mitment to promoting the Ordination of Women. Though not ambitious for her- self, was always deeply involved in Church admin. She received a Lambeth Degree from Archbishop of Canterbury. Ambition for ordination of women led to high level involvement in pastoral organisation and Church House/Build- ings Management. In 1968 she became professional Chairman of The Redund- ant Churches Committee. By 1972 she was the{first woman}Third Church Estates Commissioner and to Chair The General Synod. Contd..
